page.title: 07Family Life
page.content: As a result of our survey, it was interesting to note that the areas population was fairly static with only 10% of families interviewed expected to move within the next five years. Some 40% of the sample were from outside the area, notably 28% from the south of England. This was largely occasioned by the change of employment patterns in Sheffield with the decline in steel making and heavy engineering, there has been an influx of people employed by the{Midland Bank}, which recently moved its head office to Sheffield and by the{Manpower Services {Commision}which also recently moved into the city. There was very little evidence of adult un-employment and the majority of the sample questions were in professional and managerial posts with a significant minority of self-employed businessmen.
